awd_titl_txt: Student Support: 2020 Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference and 48th North American Manufacturing Research Conference; Cincinnati, Ohio; June 22-26, 2020
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports 78 graduate and undergraduate students studying at US institutions to participate in the co-located conference event consisting of the 2020 International Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference sponsored by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers and the 48th Annual North American Manufacturing Research Conference sponsored by the North American Manufacturing Research Institution of the Society of Manufacturing Engineers. These two leading conferences in the Manufacturing Engineering field act as global bridges between industries, government laboratories, and academic institutions. The award provides student participants with opportunities to exchange ideas with leading researchers and engineers from worldwide industrial and governmental facilities, as well as with students and faculty from both domestic and international engineering schools. In addition to nurturing a global manufacturing vision, participants will learn the latest research areas and results in manufacturing fields. 

This award will provide support for conference registration and accommodation for student attendees. The call for student support applications will be disseminated through postings on main conference websites, promulgation through conference organizers, track chairs, and symposium organizers, and direct communication with students involved in poster session, student design competition and student author research presentation competition. The submitted applications go through a selection process by the conference committee. The eligibility criteria to receive the funding include (1) students must be from US institutions and (2) students must be actively participating in the conference through presenting a paper or poster, or participating in a competition, with preference given to students from underrepresented minorities. After the conference, the list of student awardees will be announced on the main conference website, in the Manufacturing Science and Engineering 2019 post-conference report in the Manufacturing Engineering Division's Newsletter, and in the Award and Recognition section on the North American Manufacturing Research Institution's website. This award will enable these students to improve their knowledge of manufacturing technologies, and help them to become engineers and researchers to lead the next generation of US manufacturing.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

por.por_cntn:
This project supported 197 selected graduate and undergraduate students studying at U.S. institutions so that they could participate in the co-located conference consisting of the 2021 International Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference (MSEC 2021) sponsored by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) and the 49th Annual North American Manufacturing Research Conference (NAMRC 49) sponsored by the North American Manufacturing Research Institution of the Society of Manufacturing Engineers (NAMRI/SME). These are each world-class conferences in the Manufacturing Engineering field, and as such act as global bridges between industries, government laboratories, and academic institutions. The conferences consisted of keynote speeches, technical oral and poster presentations, a student manufacturing design competition, an early career forum, and a doctoral student symposium. In addition, the project provided student participants with opportunities to exchange ideas with leading researchers and engineers from industrial and governmental facilities around the world, as well as with students and faculty from both domestic and international universities. Aside from nurturing a global manufacturing vision, participants could learn about the latest research and developments in manufacturing engineering. These opportunities not only provided opportunities to improve the participants’ knowledge of manufacturing technologies but also to help develop engineers and researchers that are ideally suited to lead the next generation of U.S. manufacturing. The intellectual merit of the project included technical papers and posters presentations that showcased the latest trends in materials, processes, metrology, control systems, bio/sustainable-manufacturing, composites, additive manufacturing, and micro/nano manufacturing. The four-day conference built upon the success of the past nine co-located conferences, which each brought together over 500 participants, and further defined an international forum focusing on manufacturing, which is key to the U.S. economy.  The single registration fee allowed participants to virtually attend all the technical events and receive the conference proceedings. NAMRC 49 / MSEC 2021 brought together 536 participants from 24 countries using the vFairs online conference platform. Approximately 85% of the total registered conference attendees came from academic institutions, 10% from industry, and 5% from government. The broader impacts of this project allowed for the participation of 197 students studying in U.S. institutions to defray their cost of attending the conference. These awardees also included students from historically underrepresented groups, including 51 women, 11 Latinos/African Americans, and 23 undergraduate students, as well as a number of other PhD, MS, and BS students. The involvement of these students in what is the preeminent manufacturing research gathering in the United States will not only stimulate learning and training for the students, but also allow them to be exposed to new manufacturing research concepts and continue to interact with the researchers defining them. In addition to acquiring knowledge and a broader understanding of manufacturing technology, becoming involved with professional societies will motivate their intellectual curiosity through developing a network of professional contacts and resources.  This contact network will continue to support students in the long term, through their professional career. Overall, the project results have contributed to helping strengthen the manufacturing field in the United States.


Last Modified: 11/24/2021
Modified by: Arif S Malik
